Comment: Hello!!!! This is a game that i played for a mini tournament i participate....I won the game with white in 30 moves and now i have black....I used to play with with white but i think i'm quite good with black too....So he started with e4..
Lately i like to play c5...Sicilian is always good for black though used to play e5 in the past...
e5 is not a very common reply and i think is not helping white very much...I like to play the Najdorf variation but now the best is Nc6.
So i played Nc6...I actually never played this variation in the past not even in a blitz game...
f4? Quite strange move i think again...Better would be Nf3..
d6 i think is a nice and safe move for black playing this variation...What do you think?
That seems logical...My king's side is still disorganized and i was thinking about g6 to do...
But i decided to exchange the pawns...What do you think of that?
He took it...
I guess pushing his knight with that move will give me something good...
For me this is a bad move...Is blocking his bishop.
Cause the knight threat is coming..
He play Qc4 to protect the queen
I took the knight and then it may come: ... 8. gxf3 Nxf3+ 9. Kd1 Nxe5 and threaten the queen...
He played Qa4+ and check my King...
But i repied with my bishop to protect the king and the bishop as well....Now he's down a piece...
The c5 pawn is exposed...
But now is not...The thought of playing g6 will not be only a thought..
To open the line for the black bishop...
My queen should attack now...Also my knight is placed in a good square that may help my queen....
